name: Racket Docs Darker
description: An edit of Racket Docs Dark with some nicer font coloring, among other things.
additional_info: An edit of Racket Docs Dark with darker fonts and some better backgrounds for certain elements. ===== Note 1: if you want to apply this style to your local docs, simply find the doc directory that is under your main Racket directory (invoking $ which racket in your shell may aid in finding this) and copy this CSS to the bottom of doc/manual-style.css. I'm sure you could write a script to do that automatically, if you're into that sort of thing ;) (fyi, the CSS file is here in case you are interested in that) To also apply this on your local package docs, search page, etc. you may also have to patch user-specific doc/manual-style.css files that are located in another directory somewhere under your home directory. On OS X, this is ~/Library/Racket. Linux probably has a similar location somewhere in your home directory, as well. For Windows, I'm not sure. ===== Note 2: this style also applies to Jay McCarthy's blog as well as Greg Hendershott's "Fear of Macros" tutorial. It's applied to these sites because 1) they use the same style as the Racket docs and 2) they contain a lot of useful information about Racket, so they're pretty much Racket docs as well.
